Here are the lists of major improvements in each of the new builds: The ReSharper 2024.3 Release Candidate The ReSharper C++ 2024.3 […]

excerpt: Get a preview of all the latest features and improvements set to be shipped with the next major ReSharper and .NET tools releases by downloading the Release Candidate builds that have just landed.
text: Essential productivity kit for .NET and game developers .NET Tools News Releases Resharper C++ ReSharper PlatformThe ReSharper and the .NET Tools 2024.3 Release Candidates Are Now Available Get a preview of all the latest features and improvements set to be shipped with the next major ReSharper and .NET tools releases by downloading the Release Candidate builds that have just landed. Here are the lists of major improvements in each of the new builds: The ReSharper 2024.3 Release Candidate Comprehensive support for C# 13, including params collections, partial properties, a new lock type, and the field keyword (preview feature). Enhanced code cleanup and flexible formatting options. More precise naming conventions for local functions and methods. Support for multiline To-do comments for organized in-code task management. Tooltip colorization for improved readability across C# messages. IL Viewer support for assembly manifests in the decompiler. Support for primary constructors in decompiled code. The ReSharper C++ 2024.3 Release Candidate Move to Folder refactoring for C++ files. Support for new C++23, C23, and GNU language features. Optimized memory footprint in large solutions. Improved interoperability with Clang tooling. Various code assistance features for Unreal Engine developers. Better support for XML documentation comments. The dotMemory 2024.3 Release Candidate Unified UI across all operating systems for a consistent experience. Reintroduced Creation Stack Trace and Back Traces views for memory issue identification. New Icicle chart for dominator visualization and Sunburst chart for the Call Tree view on all OS. The dotTrace 2024.3 Release Candidate Undo/Redo actions and filter history support for easier navigation through profiling sessions. The dotCover 2024.3 Release Candidate Stability improvements and bug fixes. The dotPeek 2024.3 Release Candidate IL Viewer support for assembly manifests in the decompiler. Support for primary constructors in decompiled code. Just a reminder that you can download the latest build right now from the ReSharper 2024.3 EAP page or install it via the JetBrains Toolbox App.It’s not too late to share your feedback on the newest features! Our developers are still putting the final touches on the upcoming release. Tell us what you think in the comments below or by reaching out to us on X. html:
Essential productivity kit for .NET and game developers

.NET Tools News Releases Resharper C++ ReSharper Platform

The ReSharper and the .NET Tools 2024.3 Release Candidates Are Now Available

Get a preview of all the latest features and improvements set to be shipped with the next major ReSharper and .NET tools releases by downloading the Release Candidate builds that have just landed.

Here are the lists of major improvements in each of the new builds:

The ReSharper 2024.3 Release Candidate

  • Comprehensive support for C# 13, including params collections, partial properties, a new lock type, and the field keyword (preview feature).
  • Enhanced code cleanup and flexible formatting options.
  • More precise naming conventions for local functions and methods.
  • Support for multiline To-do comments for organized in-code task management.
  • Tooltip colorization for improved readability across C# messages.
  • IL Viewer support for assembly manifests in the decompiler.
  • Support for primary constructors in decompiled code.

The ReSharper C++ 2024.3 Release Candidate

  • Move to Folder refactoring for C++ files.
  • Support for new C++23, C23, and GNU language features.
  • Optimized memory footprint in large solutions.
  • Improved interoperability with Clang tooling.
  • Various code assistance features for Unreal Engine developers.
  • Better support for XML documentation comments.

The dotMemory 2024.3 Release Candidate

  • Unified UI across all operating systems for a consistent experience.
  • Reintroduced Creation Stack Trace and Back Traces views for memory issue identification.
  • New Icicle chart for dominator visualization and Sunburst chart for the Call Tree view on all OS.

The dotTrace 2024.3 Release Candidate

  • Undo/Redo actions and filter history support for easier navigation through profiling sessions.

The dotCover 2024.3 Release Candidate

Stability improvements and bug fixes.

The dotPeek 2024.3 Release Candidate

  • IL Viewer support for assembly manifests in the decompiler.
  • Support for primary constructors in decompiled code.

Just a reminder that you can download the latest build right now from the ReSharper 2024.3 EAP page or install it via the JetBrains Toolbox App.
It’s not too late to share your feedback on the newest features! Our developers are still putting the final touches on the upcoming release. Tell us what you think in the comments below or by reaching out to us on X.
